title: True Image 2021 - LPE via XPC service communication

profile.name: Acronis
profile.about: Acronis sets the standard for cyber protection through its backup, anti-ransomware and cyber infrastructure

structured_scope.asset_identifier: Acronis Cyber Protect Home Office (formerly Acronis True Image)

activities.message:
Hi @theevilbit 

Thanks for participating in Acronis bug bounty program!
We will review the report and come back to you asap.

@theevilbit 

Can you please provide a video PoC for the steps mentioned above? When I follow the steps on a clean installation, on the `run ATI 2020` step the system prompts me for password. Did you assume that both 2020 and 2021 versions should already be installed on a victim's machine?

Hi @iradostev ,

I can make a video but later. You don't need to enter the password and the 2020 version shouldn't be installed at all, just copied. Did you put the file `env.dylib` to `/Users/Shared/env.dylib`? That is what is being injected into `/Users/Shared/Acronis True Image.app/Contents/MacOS/backup_worker` by the priv helper.

In some rare cases Terminal doesn't show up, but in the activity monitor you can see it's running as root. Of course Terminal is just an example, we could run anything else.

Csaba

> Did you put the file `env.dylib` to `/Users/Shared/env.dylib`?

Yes, the directory structure is

```
$ ls /Users/Shared
Acronis True Image.app    acronis.dylib    env.dylib
```

Unfortunately, I do not see terminal being launched even in activity monitor

Hi,

Here is the video. As shown in the video the 2021 should be closed, otherwise it will fail. I first run it without the 2021 window being closed, and then after I closed it it worked. I also showed that I inject into the 2020 version, which has the permissive entitlements.

Csaba

additional_data.new_title: True Image 2021 - LPE via XPC service communication

activities.message:
Yep, you're right. Something was messed up on my test environment. Tried it on a clean installation and it worked. Thanks for clarification!

Similarly to previous report #908152, we believe this is medium due to exploit complexity and environmental factor.

We appreciate your efforts and waiting for new reports from you.

Cool! Glad that you could reproduce it!

I still think that a low priv user to root LPE is more than Medium (this bug is not admin -> root, but low priv user -> root). Again, an LPE assumes code execution on the box, and Gatekeeper as such is not in play here. I suppose you make the final call, but still wanted to point this out. Also this attack is not complex. I would appreciate it if you reconsider the severity.

Thanks!

Thanks for participating in Acronis bug bounty program! Bounty is transferred to your account.
Happy bug hunting and we are waiting for new reports from you.

Thanks for catching this bug!

We have fixed it, please confirm that you are no longer able to reproduce the issue.

Hi @theevilbit

We believe the issue has been fixed, you can find corresponding release notes here: https://www.acronis.com/en-eu/support/updates/changes.html?p=42254. As per our policy, we request an additional 90 days of non-disclosure to give our customers time to update their installations, so the proposed disclosure date is February 10, 2021 (note that this also applies to #908152). Please let me know if you're ok with it.

Hi,

I see you perform more checks now.

The disclosure date is fine.

Thanks,
Csaba

Hi @theevilbit,
It turned out that we need a little bit more time to release True Image 2020 containing backported fix for this issue. Current release date is set to February 16, 2021.

Is it okay with you if we will disclose this issue a few days later, e.g. February 20, 2021?

Hi @stushieva ,

Yes, that will do. I will discuss this bug on a conference in March 5th.

Csaba

@theevilbit,
Just out of curiosity, what conference is it?

Hi,

We reached the agreed date. Can you disclose this?

Thanks,
Csaba
